title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: William Cithrow to John W. Jordan, May 21, 1868
summary: Responding to Jordan's request for a school report, Cithrow describes the situation in the area around Waynesboro. He writes that although he taught a Sabbath school for blacks, his resources were stretched too thin to keep it going. He also comments on the level of interest in setting up a proper school for blacks among the black and white communities in the area.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Education, Church/Religious Activity, Race Relations, American Civil War
